lead_paragraph: Rob Johnson of INET sends me to an interesting paper by Autor, Dorn and Hanson (pdf) that uses regional data to estimate the impact of China imports on manufacturing employment. The idea is to exploit the major differences among US metro areas in industrial specialization: some areas produce a mix of goods that is in effect in China's path, while others don't. The results suggest, as I have been arguing, that it's wrong to dismiss Chinese exports as not really being in competition with US production.
